page.title: 09THE MANOR HOUSE
page.content: The Manor House which is situated in Wadworth is to be found on the road which leads to Rossington. The Manor House was built in the 14th century and was made out of limestone and in that century the Fitzwilliams owned it and then the Copley family bought it. The roof has been covered or thacked with stone slates. The windows didn't have wooden frames round they had stone pillars. In 1750 or somewhere round that time the Arthur family sold the house to a Josiah Wordsworth who also bought and built Wadworth Hall. Then they moved back to Wadworth Hall and the Manor House just became a farm house. Now a man called Donald Butler owns the Manor House and it is no longer a Farm House Donald Butler just lives there.
